isis.stitle: 5 SPEED AND 6 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - ASSEMBLE - SHIFTER HOUSING (FS-5205)

note.para: Interlock balls, detent balls, and springs can be used interchangeably.
Lubricate yoke pads and inserts with oil before assembly. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubes.
Lubricate yoke bar grooves with grease before assembly.
Keep yoke bars in neutral while assembling.
Shift yoke retainer holes are not tapped on new shifter housings. Bolts used are "thread forming" and can be re-used if shifter housing is replaced.
It may be necessary to support yoke bars in position while installing the retainers.

step1.para: Install interlock balls, detent balls and springs in the following order ( Figure 100):

figure.caption: Figure 100. Install Interlock Balls, Detent Balls and Springs

step2.para: Position three (3) balls in the reverse light switch bore.
Position two (2) balls in adjacent cross bore.
Position two (2) balls in adjacent cross bore.

step1.para: Seat the 1st-reverse actuator over the actuator pivot pin ( Figure 101).

figure.caption: Figure 101. Seat 1st-Reverse Actuator Over Actuator Pivot Pin and Position 1st-Reverse Yoke Assembly in Housing

step1.para: Position 1st-reverse yoke assembly in the housing ( Figure 101).
Install the 1st-reverse lock pin in the yoke assembly.
Position 1st-reverse bar assembly in the housing ( Figure 102).

figure.caption: Figure 102. Position 1st-Reverse Bar Assembly in Housing

step1.para: Make sure the 1st-reverse spacers are in position ( Figure 103).

figure.caption: Figure 103. Install 2nd-3rd Yoke Interlock Pin and Position 2nd-3rd Yoke

step1.para: Install the 2nd-3rd yoke interlock pin ( Figure 103).
Position the 2nd-3rd yoke in the housing assembly ( Figure 103).
Position the 4th-5th yoke in the housing assembly ( Figure 104).

figure.caption: Figure 104. Position 4th-5th Yoke in Housing Assembly

step1.para: Position retainers; front retainer in the rear set of holes ( Figure 105).

figure.caption: Figure 105. Position Retainers, Install Bolts in Rear Retainer, and Shift 4th-5th Yoke into 4th Gear Position

step1.para: Install the bolts in rear retainer ( Figure 105).Tighten to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 N• m).
Carefully shift the 4th-5th yoke into 4th gear position (rearward) ( Figure 105).
Install the bolts in front retainer ( Figure 106). Tighten to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 N• m).

figure.caption: Figure 106. Install Bolts in Front Retainer

note.para: Make sure interlock system is working-can't shift into 2 gears at the same time.
